WRITING.TITLE: So I gave this brainteaser to my 7th grade students, and then attempted to solve it myself but I didn't get the answer they listed on their answer key as did other students and even the math teacher. Can someone explain their answer or point out my flaw.

WRITING.TEXT: Nailed it. You need 3 corners in the new era of the NFL. Just like you need 3 capable WRs to be a good offense. Teams make it a point to pick on 3rd CBs. Plus, Smith isn't a spring chicken anymore. I think the raiders have to take him at 14 if he is available.
Hit on the head. No way hargreaves gets past us.
Would you then assume we would get their second round or third round?
Especially if they don't sign Fitzpatrick they could be desperate for a QB and move up before the Rams pick.
Is there a scenario where we would swap first round picks with the Jets and get Wilkerson? Maybe we add a 5th round with/or Jelly.
I would really like to see David Bruton from Denver. The dude flys on special teams.
Ha! I love this. I think you're close. Earn respect in the AFC West, maybe win the division. Get to the playoffs. Make some noise and make some the city show their hand.
